isis.stitle: DCM AND DDM DRUM TYPE PARKING BRAKE - ROCKWELL DUPLEX CAM MECHANICAL BRAKE - DISASSEMBLY

warning.para: During brake servicing, you should wear an air purifying respirator with high-efficiency filters approved by OSHA for brake dust. Disposable dust masks are no longer considered adequate protection by OSHA for brake service.

svcprocinfo.para: Refer to Figure 3for all Item numbers in parentheses.

step1.para: Block wheels to prevent vehicle from moving.
Disconnect the driveshaft and lower to floor. Refer to GROUP 06 - PROPELLER SHAFT in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual for service information for the type of shaft being disconnected.
Place the parking brake lever in the released position.
Remove the brake drum (this may require removal of a yoke or companion flange).
Remove one side of the shoe return springs (Item 4) using a suitable brake spring removal tool.
Pivot one shoe from the anchor pins to allow the actuator strut (Item 1) to be pulled out of the retaining lance of the shoe.
Lift the actuator strut (Item 1) from the cam (Item 2) and pull it out of the retaining lance of the other shoe.
Remove the remaining shoe return springs (Item 4). Both shoes can now be removed for service.

svcsubproc.title: Backing Plate and Cam Service
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 3for all Item numbers in parentheses.

step1.para: Release the brake cable clevis from the actuator lever (Item 5).
Remove the nut and washer (Items 6 and 7) that hold the lever to the cam.
Remove the lever (Item 5) from the cam (Item 2).
Remove the cam from the backing plate (Item 3).
Make a note of how the backing plate is mounted. Use the position of the cam as a reference point. Remove the capscrews securing the backing plate to its mount.
